comments:
When a profile test is run as a java application, the device has a null transport during the initialization path of the profile.  The Profile setup method calls getDefaultDevice which calls loadService which creates the device but not the transport.  When the profile has measurements which are initialized by invoking a call to the device, the device will throw a RuntimeException because there is no transport.  

Here is a sample stack trace from a GpioProfileTest (SamsysChumpGpioProifleTest.java):

[ERROR] 2007-06-13 12:49:45.016 - DigitalIOGetRequest
java.lang.RuntimeException: Device3017: No transport to send message exception.
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.device.TransportDevice.send(TransportDevice.java:241)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.command.SimpleMessageCommand.execute(SimpleMessageCommand.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.measurement.ReadMeasurement.executeRead(ReadMeasurement.java:91)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.profile.Profile.initializeMeasurement(Profile.java:327)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.samsys.chump.gpio.profile.SamsysChumpGpioProfile.setDevice(SamsysChumpGpioProfile.java:303)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.profile.Profile.setup(Profile.java:442)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.device.Container.start(Container.java:1450)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.device.Device.start(Device.java:556)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.profile.test.ProfileTest.run(ProfileTest.java:986)
	at org.eclipse.soda.dk.samsys.chump.gpio.profile.test.SamsysChumpGpioProfileTest.main(SamsysChumpGpioProfileTest.java:59)

traces.message: Device3017: No transport to send message exception.
